reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Conserving kipunji Rungwecebus kipunji strongholds in southern Tanzania

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes “Conserving kipunji Rungwecebus kipunji strongholds in Southern Tanzania.” In partnership with Wildlife Conservation Society this project will support the long-term survival of the Kipunji in the Mount Rungwe and Livingstone forests in Tanzania. Specific activities include: employ forest guards to improve law enforcement in both the Livingston and Mt Rungwe forests and will ensure patrol areas will be surveyed on a continuous basis; (2) address the root cause of forest degredation by developing alternative fuels sources with locally managed woodlots that will provide 75% of required wood to villages and will pilot the use of fuel efficient stoves; (3) reduce human-monkey conflict by developing an effective crop raiding mitigation methods to reduce retributional hunting; (4) Determine appropriate cash crops to plant adjacent to the forest to reduce hunting threats; (5) conduct environmental education and outreach on the importance of the forest in 20 villages..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Fish and Wildlife Service/Office of International Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Strong partners for over five decades, Tanzania and the United States are working towards a shared vision of improving the quality of life for all Tanzanians. Despite its political stability and high levels of economic growth over the past two decades, roughly 28 percent of the population lives below the poverty line. The goal of U.S. assistance is to promote a healthy, prosperous, democratic, well-governed and secure Tanzania.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Resource Management, United States Fish and Wildlife Service, Interior
